content.content: After the recent delegation of votes to MakerDAO, I would like to know if there is a possibility to measure this. To be able to see the growth over time in % of how we were before and how we are now thanks to the delegation.

content.content: What growth are you trying to measure exactly? We can measure the amount of MKR delegated via the new delegation UI but I’m guessing you are looking for a different metric.
Yes, that is, to be able to see how much the participation has increased with respect to previous votes. It would be very interesting to see that.
That makes sense. Right now I think your best bet is to use the MCD Voting Portal to track voting activity over time. If there is a better way I’m all ears.

content.content: I can give an example analytic I have been wanting to see for a while now. Take all wallets that have MKR in governance.    For some selected time frame calculate.  pools offered executives offered  for each wallet calculate % of pools voted on, % of executives supported.  Then for the wallet of interest and over the time period specified give a %pool vote participation number and %executive participation number.  Make graphs of these with weekly or monthly bin periods.  Or even per governance pool/executive cycle (as a number vs. date). Then what would be nice is to use the above data to calculate over the period something like a %MKR participation rate as follows. Amount of MKR that did vote on a poll/Total of MKR that could. Sum this up over all polls and divide by the number of polls to normalize it as a %MKR voting per poll Do the same for executives.

I agree, it would be interested in getting a high-level sense of participation rates over time to gain a better understand what is driving this activity. I also think we could gather some UI inspiration from Compound’s governance leaderboard, which I think does a great job of displaying granular voter activity/info.
